Wali Kota Bekasi Jawab Imbauan Tito Karnavian Soal Parkir
06 Nov 2019, 07:35 by Adi Warsono (Kontributor), Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Wali Kota Bekasi Rahmat Effendi menjawab imbauan Mendagri Tito Karnavian soal penarikan pajak parkir di depan minimarket yang dikuasai oleh sekelompok preman berkedok organisasi masyarakat. Menurut Rahmat, Pemkot Bekasi saat ini tengah menata regulasi terkait perparkiran tersebut.
Rahmat menyatakan bahwa pihaknya berupaya untuk terus menggali potensi pendapatan daerah berdasarkan regulasi yang dibuat pemerintah. Penataan perparkiran menurut dia, adalah salah satu potensi tersebut.
"Saya sudah bilang, pemerintah Kota Bekasi itu berdasarkan potensi yang ada. (Pemerintah) melakukan ekstensifikasi, ekstensifikasi itu sama dengan penataan," kata Rahmat Effendi di Plasa Pemkot Bekasi, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
"Jadi kalau Pak Mendagri bilang, kita (sekarang) melakukan penataan tentunya regulasinya sedang kita tata," ujar Rahmat Effendi.
Sebelumnya video tentang pengelolaan lahan parkir di Kota Bekasi oleh organisasi masyarakat viral di media sosial. Dalam video tersebut, pemerintah Kota Bekasi meminta kepada pengusaha minimarket supaya kerja sama dengan organisasi masyarakat dalam pengelolaan lahan parkir.
Video tersebut dibuat pada saat aksi unjuk rasa di sebuah minimarket di SPBU, Jalan Raya Narogong, Rawalumbu pada 23 Oktober 2019 lalu. Dalam aksi unjuk rasa tersebut, masa dari ormas sempat memblokade Jalan Raya Narogong, sehingga menyebabkan kemacetan parah.
Kepala Bapeda Kota Bekasi, Aan Suhanda, dalam video tersebut sempat menanyakan apakah indomaret tersebut bersedia bekerja sama dengan ormas atau tidak. Perwakilan toko awalnya menjawab bersedia, namun sekelompok anggota ormas tampak memberikan tekanan.
"Bersedia-bersedia, tidak-tidak, begitu yang jelas," kata orang dalam video tersebut yang kemudian pemilik toko menyatakan kesediannya lalu disambut tepuk tangan.
Video tersebut viral setelah diunggah oleh akun Facebook pengusaha Peter F Gontha. Dalam penggalan keterangan video tersebut terbesit kekhawatiran Bekasi akan dikuasai preman seperti Meksiko, Brasil dan negara Amerika Latin lainnya.
Video tersebut lantas mendapatkan tanggapan dari Mendagri Tito Karnavian. Menurut Tito, parkir yang dikelola preman dapat merugikan masyarakat dan berpotensi menjadi pungutan liar. Selain itu, perparkiran di kota besar melibatkan uang yang cukup besar yang bisa menjadi potensi pendapatan daerah.
Karena itu, Tito mengimbau setiap kepala daerah untuk melakukan penataan regulasi perparkiran.
Rahmat mengakui bahwa pihaknya memang menggandeng ormas sebagai pengelola parkir di depan minimarket. Perihal unjuk rasa ormas yang viral karena dinilai menekan pemerintah dan pengusaha, Rahmat memakluminya.
"Karena memang berhadapan dengan teman-teman yang pada taraf pemahaman tidak seperti kita, ini butuh waktu," kata dia.
Sejauh ini Rahmat menambahkan, setelah aksi unjuk rasa yang viral, pemerintah menghentikan penarikan pajak parkir di depan minimarket. Badan Pendapatan Daerah tak lagi mengeluarkan surat tugas kepada perseorangan sebagai eksekutor penarikan parkir kepada pengunjung.
"Saran Pak Kapolres, orang yang jadi juru parkir juga harus lolos SKCK, sehingga nanti nyaman, nah dengan kenyamanan itu Insya Allah Kota Bekasi, menjadi kota tujuan investasi," ucap Rahmat Effendi.

The Mayor of Bekasi Answer Tito Karnavian's Appeal Regarding Parking
Nov 6, 2019, 07:35 by Adi Warsono (Contributor), Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Bekasi Mayor Rahmat Effendi answered Minister of Domestic Affairs Tito Karnavian's appeal about parking tax collection in front of a minimarket controlled by a group of thugs under the guise of community organizations. According to Rahmat, Bekasi City Government is currently arranging regulations related to parking.
Rahmat said that his side tried to continue to explore the potential of regional income based on regulations made by the government. Parking management according to him, is one of these potentials.
"I have already said, the Bekasi City government is based on the existing potential. (The Government) extends, extensification is the same as the arrangement," Rahmat Effendi said at the Bekasi City Government Plaza, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
"So if the Minister of Home Affairs says, we (now) are arranging the regulations, of course we are arranging the regulations," Rahmat Effendi said.
Previous video about the management of parking lots in the city of Bekasi by viral community organizations on social media. In the video, the Bekasi City government asks minimarket entrepreneurs to cooperate with community organizations in managing parking lots.
The video was made during a demonstration at a convenience store at SPBU, Jalan Raya Narogong, Rawalumbu on 23 October 2019. During the rally, the mass organization had blocked the Narogong Highway, causing severe traffic jams.
Head of Bapeda Kota Bekasi, Aan Suhanda, in the video asked whether the indomaret was willing to cooperate with CSOs or not. The shop representative initially said he was willing, but a group of members of the mass organization seemed to put pressure.
"Be willing, no, no, that's clear," said the person in the video who then the shop owner expressed his willingness and applause was greeted.
The video was viral after it was uploaded by the Facebook account of entrepreneur Peter F Gontha. In the fragment of the video description, there was a concern that Bekasi would be controlled by thugs like Mexico, Brazil and other Latin American countries.
The video then received a response from Minister of Home Affairs Tito Karnavian. According to Tito, parking managed by thugs can be detrimental to the community and has the potential to become illegal levies. In addition, parking in big cities involves a large amount of money which can be a potential regional income.
Therefore, Tito appealed to each regional head to make arrangements for parking regulations.
Rahmat acknowledged that his party did hold a mass organization as the parking manager in front of the minimarket. Regarding the viral mass demonstration because it was considered pressing the government and businessmen, Rahmat acknowledged it.
"Because it is indeed dealing with friends who are at an understanding level unlike us, it takes time," he said.
So far Rahmat added, after the viral demonstration, the government stopped collecting parking taxes in front of the minimarket. Regional Revenue Agency no longer issues assignment letters to individuals as executors of parking withdrawals to visitors.
"The advice of the Chief of Police, people who become parking attendants must also pass the SKCK, so that later it will be comfortable, well with that comfort, Insya Allah, Bekasi City, becoming an investment destination city," said Rahmat Effendi.
